title: Tennessee Titans will start Ryan Tannehill at QB vs. Los Angeles Chargers, per report
text:
CLOSE SportsPulse: The Dallas Cowboys have taken a huge tumble over the last few weeks in the power rankings while the San Francisco 49ers continue to rise. USA TODAY

NASHVILLE — The Tennessee Titans are rolling with Ryan Tannehill.

Tennessee is set to start Tannehill at quarterback over incumbent starter Marcus Mariota when it faces the Los Angeles Chargers on Sunday, according to NFL Network.

The decision comes a couple of days after Titans coach Mike Vrabel yanked Mariota, their longtime starting QB, in favor of Tannehill in the second half of their Week 6 shutout loss at Denver. Mariota completed 7 of 18 passes for 63 yards with two interceptions, the second of which represented the final straw for Vrabel.

Tannehill replaced Mariota in the third quarter and finished the game for Tennessee, completing 13 of 16 passes for 144 yards with an interception. Under Tannehill, the offense at least had a pulse, though both quarterbacks struggled behind another abysmal performance by the offensive line.

Neither quarterback is under contract with the Titans beyond this season.

Mariota had played all but two garbage-time snaps through the first five weeks of the season. He said his benching Sunday was the first time he was pulled in his career due to poor play.

The decision also indicates Tannehill could be the guy for the Titans moving forward. On Monday, Vrabel said during a press conference that, "I don't think the answer is a revolving door at that position."

Reach Erik Bacharach at ebacharach@tennessean.com and on Twitter @ErikBacharach.

If you love talking football, we have the perfect spot for you. Join our Facebook Group, The Ruling Off the Field, to engage in friendly debate and conversation with fellow football fans and our NFL insiders.
description: The Tennessee Titans will start RYan Tannehill at quarterback over incumbent starter Marcus Mariota in Sunday's game against the Los Angeles Chargers.
